entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 4:22AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...THREE TO SIX INCHES OF SNOW EXPECTED FOR THE EVENING COMMUTE THROUGH TONIGHT... A storm system lifting northeastward across Southcentral will cause widespread snow from this afternoon through the overnight hours. Snow or a rain/snow mix will develop by midday around Homer, quickly spreading north to Anchorage by mid-afternoon,

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued February 14 at 9:22AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...PM-10 HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR THE YUMA AREA TUESDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued a PM-10 High Pollution Advisory for the Yuma area on Tuesday. An episode of strong and gusty winds is forecast to generate widespread blowing dust that may result in local PM-10 concentrations that pose a health risk. Adverse health effects
entry.cap:areaDesc: Yuma

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 1:44PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A Brief Return to Winter Monday Evening into Tuesday Morning... A fast moving slider-type low pressure system will move across eastern California and western Nevada Monday evening into early Tuesday morning. This will bring an increase in winds Monday afternoon into Monday night, with colder conditions and a short period of rain and snow Monday evening through early Tuesday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...South Washington Cascades above 2500 feet. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon.
entry.cap:areaDesc: South Washington Cascades

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 14 at 6:25AM PST until February 15 at 1:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow above 3000 feet. Snow accumulations of 3 to 9 inches. * WHERE...Cascade mountains and valleys of Pierce and Lewis Counties, including the Crystal Mountain Ski Area and Paradise
entry.cap:areaDesc: West Slopes South Central Cascades and Passes

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued February 14 at 3:25AM MST until February 14 at 8:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 30 to 40 mph. Gusts around 55 mph expected with brief periods of wind gusts up to 65 mph possible. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills, including Interstate 80
entry.cap:areaDesc: North Snowy Range Foothills
